content.rendered:
M-Arch

Master of Architecture or M.Arch is a postgraduate Architecture Engineering course which deals with the principles of design and construction of buildings and also gives way to research concepts.

M-Arch

Architecture is a discipline of designing and constructing buildings which involves concepts of planning, architecture, and design fundamentals.

  • Master of Architecture (M.Arch) incorporates elements of both rural and urban, residential and commercial infrastructure, imparted through a professionally oriented curriculum.
  • The Council of Architecture (COA) is the regulating body concerned with education and practice of this profession. 
  • The Master of Architecture or M.Arch course also involves designing or construction of Parks, Museums, Garden, Theme Parks, etc.
  • There are several specializations in this field like Landscape Architecture, Green Architecture, Naval Architecture and many others

Why Study M.Arch?

  • Master of Architecture [M.Arch] is an advanced and detailed study of Architecture which is tangible.
  • As demand for commercial space increases, there is strong growth in non-residential construction.
  • Architectural course (M.Arch) enables one to design any kind of structure system which includes a wide variety of buildings, such as office and apartment buildings, schools, churches, factories, hospitals, houses, and airport terminals.
  • An Architect acquires a multi-dimensional role whose guidance is required in the execution of construction projects, client discussions, and preparation of the blueprint, budget decision, and supervision.

M.Arch Specializations

Master of Architecture is a postgraduate programme with specializations in different fields:

  • Urban Design: M.Arch in Urban Design is a 2-year post graduate program dealing with the design and construction of fine buildings. This program is divided into 4 semesters that vary from institute to institute.
Average FeeINR 1.25 lakhs per annum
Average Starting SalaryINR 1 to 6 lakhs per annum

 

  • Urban and Rural Planning: M.Arch in Urban and Rural Planning is a postgraduate course which teaches basics of planning and applications of planning in daily life.

Average FeeINR 1.14 lakhs 
Average Starting SalaryINR 2.9 to 3.7 lakhs per annum

 

  • Landscape Architecture: M.Arch in Landscape Architecture is a two year postgraduate program, focused on the tools and methods used to plan the development of a land and designing the outdoor environment.

Average FeeINR 50,000 to 2 lakhs
Average Starting SalaryINR 2 to 8 lakhs per annum

M.Arch Jobs and Career Prospects

The scope of Architecture has varied applications even in non-related areas as it is interdisciplinary in nature. Since M.Arch relies on principles of science, arts, mathematics etc., it makes one somewhat skilled and can have many M.Arch job opportunities, including other fields as well.

Most M.Arch graduates find lucrative career opportunities in areas such as:

  • Central and State Public Work Departments
  • Urban Development Corporations
  • State Housing Boards
  • Town and Country Planning Organization
  • Department of Railways
  • National Institutes of Urban Affairs and Housing
  • National Building Organization
  • City Development Authorities

Successful M.Arch postgraduates of the course are hired in capacities such as Architectural Consultant, in organizations such as DLF, L&T, Sahara Group, Eros Group etc.

The table below provides an idea of the sought after professions on successful completion of a M.Arch Degree.

Job RoleJob DescriptionAnnual Average Salary (in INR)
Architectural TechnicianArchitectural technicians work with architects and other building professionals and provide architectural design services and solutions on construction projects.11,79,172
Project architect A Project Architect oversees the architectural aspects of the development of the design and production of construction documents and specifications.6,01,688
Landscape ArchitectLandscape architects create natural and built environments that are aesthetically pleasing as well as practical, in both urban and rural areas.3,95,646
Design Architect Design Architects create plans and gather design requirements for new structures and focus on the style and look of the project while adhering to all building requirements and codes.3,76,763
Architecture ProfessorArchitecture Professors teach courses in architecture and architectural design, such as architectural environmental design, interior architecture/design, and landscape architecture.3,60,000
Architectural ConservatorArchitectural Conservators assist in activities related to research and planning and to execute preservation and conservation projects through coordination of disciplines and by following principles of scientific methods of conservation, mainly dealing with materials.4,88,832
Building InspectorBuilding Inspectors determine the structural soundness of buildings and construction projects.7,25,000
Building Control OfficerBuilding control officers examine and comment on plans for new buildings, alterations or extensions, oversee the work of building surveyors and provide them with supportive management.5,35,704
